page.title: 15CHURCHILLS FACTORY BLAYDON.
page.content: The company was first established in 1865 as a small pioneer importer of American tools. Today it specialises in engineers' tools and machine tools. The firm moved to its Blaydon site in 1955 from rented premises on the Scotswood Road Newcastle. In 1963 a new Engineering Design and Administration Block was added, and in 1965 a major factory extension was completed. The development of the micro chip led to workforce cuts as the demand for machine tools fell. During the 1970's the workforce fell from 1400 to 1000. From 1980 to 1984 the workforce fell further to 400. In July 1983 Churchills took over the Alfred Herbert Company and employed a total of 30 people to work for T.I. in Blaydon. Today the workforce of T.I. Herbert Churchill in Blaydon is 500.
